DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Recurrent Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma Diagnosis Duration Stratification Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded value for the stratification of the period of time during which a patient has been diagnosed with metastatic or recurrent squamous cell lung cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic Recurrent Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma Diagnosis Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which a patient has been diagnosed with metastatic or recurrent squamous cell lung cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Metastatic Recurrent Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from the primary site (place where it started) to other places in the body.:occurring again.:A carcinoma arising from malignant squamous bronchial epithelial cells and characterized by the presence of keratinization and/or intercellular bridges.  Cigarette smoking and arsenic exposure are strongly associated with squamous cell lung carcinoma.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

A carcinoma arising from squamous bronchial epithelial cells. It may be keratinizing or non-keratinizing. Keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma is characterized by the presence of keratinization, pearl formation, and/or intercellular bridges. Non-keratinizing squamous cell carcinoma is characterized by the absence of keratinization, pearl formation, and intercellular bridges. Cigarette smoking and arsenic exposure are strongly associated with squamous cell lung carcinoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The period of time during which something continues.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Squamous Cell Lung Cancer Duration Stratification Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The coded value for the stratification of the duration of time that a patient has been diagnosed with squamous cell lung cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Less than or equal to 6 months

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
